title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way of writing very large or very small numbers in a compact form. It involves expressing numbers as a product of a number (between $$1$$ and 10) and a power of $$10$$.

title: Identifying the Coefficient
text: Start by identifying the first non-zero digit in the given number, which in this case is $$3.34$$. This will be your coefficient.

title: Determine the Coefficient
text: What is the coefficient in the number $$0.00000000334$$ when expressed in scientific notation?

title: Counting Decimal Places for the Exponent
text: Count how many places the decimal point needs to move to the right to change $$0.00000000334$$ to the number $$3.34$$. The number of places will determine the exponent for the power of $$10$$.

title: Determine the Exponent
text: Calculate the exponent by counting the decimal places from the original number $$0.00000000334$$ to the decimal point after it becomes $$3.34$$.

title: Combining the Coefficient and Exponent
text: Combine the coefficient and the exponent into the format 'number times $$10$$ to the power of exponent'. Remember that if the decimal moves to the right, the exponent is negative.

title: Complete the Scientific Notation
text: Write the number $$0.00000000334$$ in scientific notation using the coefficient and exponent you identified.
